title: The 10 Elements of Agroecology: Enabling transitions to sustainable agriculture and food systems

tasks.task: Analyze the importance of agroecology and the 10 elements framework for sustainable agriculture.
subtasks: Understand the current challenges in the global food system and the need for urgent transition.
Recognize the benefits of sustainable agriculture in enhancing food and nutrition security, reversing environmental degradation, and adapting to climate change.
Explain the concept of agroecology and its shift from traditional to custom-made production systems.
Discuss the 10 elements of the agroecology framework and their interlinkages.
Emphasize the role of ecological, social, economic, and nutritional diversity in agroecological practices.
Describe the principles of agroecological management including diversified crop andlivestock systems, soil health, natural resource efficiency, and biodiversity.
Highlight the importance of social values, equity, and inclusive governance in agroecology.
Understand the role of circular economy and solidarity in agroecological transitions.
Recognize the need for policy, institutional, and market support for agroecological practices.
Acknowledge the bottom-up approach and territorial processes in implementing agroecology.
Appreciate the significance of knowledge sharing and collaboration in advancing agroecological practices.
Explore the potential of agroecology in addressing sustainability goals and improving livelihoods.
